params._locations: starting point, delivery points, and final destination for the shipment
params._productAddress: address of the product being shipped
params._productExpDate: the date when this batch of product will expire
params._productProdDate: the date when this batch of product is produced
params._productQuantity: quantity of the product being shipped

returns._1: _productAddress address of the contract for the product
returns._2: _receiver address of the receiver for the product
returns._4: _productProdDate the production date of the product
returns._5: _productExpDate the expire date of the product
returns._7: _locations starting point, delivery points, and final destination for the shipment

params._seconds: Number of seconds after which the location should change

addManager(address).notice: add a new manager to the contract

checkNotExpired().notice: Check if current timestamp/date has not exceeded the specified expiry date of the product

checkWithinAllowedWeatherCondition().notice: Check if current weather condition has not gone outside of allowed weather conditions

constructor.notice: constructor to create a new shipment

delivererVerify().notice: Verify/Announce that the shipment has been delivered to the final destination by the deliverer/manager side (if receiver has not already done so)

getManagers().notice: get all managers of the contract

getShipmentDetails().notice: Get the details of the shipment

moveShipment(uint256).notice: Move the shipment to a new location after a specified number of seconds

receiverVerify().notice: Verify that the shipment has been delivered to the final destination by the receiver side

updateShipmentLocation().notice: Check if the location should be updated and perform the update if necessary
